para.style: margin-top:19px; line-height:1.0; border-style:single; border-width:1px; border-top:none; border-right:none; border-left:none; tabstops:none;

para.text: This chapter describes in detail the procedures for project management: creating a new project, making a part of the project into a unit, creating and importing model fragments, importing frameworks, and including and excluding UML profiles.

Although a project can be managed as one file, it may be convenient to divide the project into units and manage them separately if more developers are working on the project simultaniously. This section describes procedures for creating and managing units.
Model fragments can be used for saving parts of a project.
